Before installing and using our custom program, ensure that you have R-Studio installed on your computer. R-Studio is an integrated development environment for R, a programming language for statistical computing and graphics. Our program leverages R-Studio for data processing and conversion tasks.

To prepare the data for the conversion task and use the premade templates, you will also need some sort of spreadsheet software like Excel or LibreOffice Calc.

## 1: Download R

R Studio requires R to be installed on your computer. Follow these steps to download and install R:

1.  Go to the [CRAN (Comprehensive R Archive Network) website](https://cran.r-project.org/).
2.  Click on the link corresponding to your operating system (Windows, macOS, or Linux).

<details>

<summary>For Windows</summary>

-   Click on "Download R for Windows".
-   Click on "base" and then "Download R 4.x.x for Windows" (the latest version number will be displayed instead of 'x.x.x').
-   Once downloaded, open the installer and follow the instructions to complete the installation.

</details>

<details>

<summary>For macOS</summary>

-   Click on "Download R for macOS".
-   Click on the link for the `.pkg` file for the latest version of R under the "Latest release" section.
-   Once downloaded, open the `.pkg` file and follow the instructions to complete the installation.

</details>

<details>

<summary>For Linux</summary>

-   Click on "Download R for Linux".
-   Follow the instructions specific to your Linux distribution to add the repository and install R using your package manager.

</details>

## 2: Download R Studio

1.  Go to the [R Studio website](https://www.rstudio.com/).
2.  Click on the "Products" tab and select "RStudio" under "Open Source".
3.  Click on the "Download" button.

**RStudio Desktop Open Source License**: Select this for personal or academic use. Click on the link for your operating system (Windows, macOS, or Linux).

<details>

<summary>For Windows</summary>

-   Open the downloaded installer (`.exe` file).
-   Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the installation.

</details>

<details>

<summary>For macOS</summary>

-   Open the downloaded disk image (`.dmg` file).
-   Drag and drop the R Studio icon into the Applications folder.

</details>

<details>

<summary>For Linux</summary>

-   Download the `.deb` file for Debian/Ubuntu or the `.rpm` file for Fedora/RedHat/CentOS.
-   For Debian/Ubuntu: \`\`\`sh sudo dpkg -i rstudio-x.y.z-amd64.deb sudo apt-get install -f

</details>

## 3: Download Excel or LibreOffice Calc

### Option 1: Microsoft Excel

<details>

<summary>Download and Install Microsoft Excel</summary>

Microsoft Excel is a powerful spreadsheet program that's part of the Microsoft Office suite. You can get it by purchasing or subscribing to Microsoft Office.

#### Step 1: Purchase or Subscribe to Microsoft Office

1.  Go to the [Microsoft Office website](https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/get-started-with-office-2021).
2.  Choose a plan that suits your needs:
    -   **Microsoft 365**: A subscription-based service that provides the latest Office applications, including Excel, with regular updates.
    -   **Office 2021**: A one-time purchase that includes Excel.

#### Step 2: Download and Install Microsoft Office

1.  After purchasing or subscribing, sign in to your Microsoft account.
2.  Go to the [Microsoft Office installation page](https://account.microsoft.com/services/office/install).
3.  Click on the "Install" button and follow the on-screen instructions to download the Office installer.
4.  Open the installer and follow the prompts to install Microsoft Office, including Excel, on your computer.

For more information and support, visit the following pages: [Microsoft Office Support](https://support.microsoft.com/office)

</details>

### Option 2: LibreOffice Calc

<details>

<summary>Download and Install LibreOffice Calc</summary>

LibreOffice Calc is a free and open-source spreadsheet program that offers many of the same features as Excel.

#### Step 1: Download LibreOffice

1.  Go to the [LibreOffice download page](https://www.libreoffice.org/download/download/).
2.  The website should automatically detect your operating system. Click on the "Download" button to download the installer for your system.
3.  If you need a different version or operating system, select the appropriate options from the dropdown menus before downloading.

#### Step 2: Install LibreOffice

1.  Once the download is complete, open the installer file.
2.  Follow the on-screen instructions to install LibreOffice on your computer.
3.  During installation, you can choose to install all LibreOffice applications or just LibreOffice Calc.
4.  After the installation is complete, you can open LibreOffice Calc from your applications menu or desktop shortcut.

For more information and support, visit the following pages: [LibreOffice Documentation](https://documentation.libreoffice.org/)

</details>
